derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French suburbe or Latin suburbium, from sub- 'near to' + urbs, urb-'city'

entry.def: A suburb of a city or large town is a smaller area which is part of the city or large town but is outside its centre.

example.ex: Anna was born in 1923 in Ardwick, a suburb of Manchester.
example.tran: 安娜于1923年出生在曼彻斯特的郊区阿德维克。

example.ex: ...the north London suburbs of Harrow, Barnet and Enfield.
example.tran: 伦敦北部郊区哈罗区、巴尼特区和恩菲尔德区。

entry.def: If you live in the suburbs, you live in an area of houses outside the centre of a large town or city.

example.ex: His family lived in the suburbs.

means.word_mean: 1. a residential district located on the outskirts of a city

stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+urban[adj.城市的, 市内的]→adj.城市远郊的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 粗野的, 粗鄙的, 无理的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+urbane[adj.温文尔雅的,懂礼的]→adj.粗野的, 粗鄙的, 无理的
urb城市+an表示地方→adj.城市的, 市内的
urbane[adj.温文尔雅的,懂礼的]+ity表名词→n.有礼貌, 文雅
sub下面+urb城市→在城市下面→郊区
